title: Libyan Football Federation
text:
The Libyan Football Federation () (LFF) is the governing body of <a href="association%20football">football</a> in <a href="Libya">Libya</a>. It was founded in 1962, affiliated to <a href="FIFA">FIFA</a> in 1964 and to <a href="Confederation%20of%20African%20Football">CAF</a> in 1965. It organizes the <a href="Libyan%20Premier%20League">national football league</a> and the <a href="Libya%20national%20football%20team">national team</a>.
Post-revolution status.
During the <a href="2011%20Libyan%20civil%20war">2011 Libyan civil war</a>, the football team continued to play, completing their <a href="2012%20African%20Cup%20of%20Nations%20qualification">2012 African Cup of Nations qualification</a> match against <a href="Mozambique%20national%20football%20team">Mozambique</a> behind closed doors on neutral territory in <a href="Cairo">Cairo</a>. Libya wore a white kit and appeared under the <a href="National%20Transitional%20Council">National Transitional Council's</a> flag of red, green and black.
